class.name: Gradient
class.description: This resource describes a color transition by defining a set of colored points and how to interpolate between them. See also [Curve] which supports more complex easing methods, but does not support colors.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds the specified color to the gradient, with the specified offset.

method.name: get_color
method.description: Returns the color of the gradient color at index [param point].

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the offset of the gradient color at index [param point].

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of colors in the gradient.

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Removes the color at index [param point].

method.name: reverse
method.description: Reverses/mirrors the gradient. [b]Note:[/b] This method mirrors all points around the middle of the gradient, which may produce unexpected results when [member interpolation_mode] is set to [constant GRADIENT_INTERPOLATE_CONSTANT].

method.name: sample
method.description: Returns the interpolated color specified by [param offset]. [param offset] should be between [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1.0[/code] (inclusive). Using a value lower than [code]0.0[/code] will return the same color as [code]0.0[/code], and using a value higher than [code]1.0[/code] will return the same color as [code]1.0[/code]. If your input value is not within this range, consider using [method @GlobalScope.remap] on the input value with output values set to [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1.0[/code].

method.name: set_color
method.description: Sets the color of the gradient color at index [param point].

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the offset for the gradient color at index [param point].

members.member: Gradient's colors as a [PackedColorArray]. [b]Note:[/b] Setting this property updates all colors at once. To update any color individually use [method set_color].

The color space used to interpolate between points of the gradient. It does not affect the returned colors, which will always use nonlinear sRGB encoding. [b]Note:[/b] This setting has no effect when [member interpolation_mode] is set to [constant GRADIENT_INTERPOLATE_CONSTANT].
The algorithm used to interpolate between points of the gradient.
Gradient's offsets as a [PackedFloat32Array]. [b]Note:[/b] Setting this property updates all offsets at once. To update any offset individually use [method set_offset].

constants.constant: Constant interpolation, color changes abruptly at each point and stays uniform between. This might cause visible aliasing when used for a gradient texture in some cases.
[url=https://bottosson.github.io/posts/oklab/]Oklab[/url] color space. This color space provides a smooth and uniform-looking transition between colors.
